p: Of the 107 plants identified by survey respondents, eight are endemic to Jamaica. These are Piper amalago L. (Pepper elder), Rhytidophyllum tomentosum (L.) Mart. (“Search-mi-heart”), Bidens reptans (L.) G.Don (“McKatty Weed”/”Marigold”), Peperomia amplexicaulis (Sw.) A. Dietr (“Jackie’s saddle”), Oryctanthus occidentalis (L.) Eichler (“Godbush”), Pilea microphylla (L.) Liebm. (“Baby puzzle”), Smilax balbisiana Kunth (“Chany Root”), and Boehmeria jamaicaensis Urb. 1907 (“Doctor Johnson”). Of these, P. amalago L. has the most notable medicinal use [ 13].
